page.title: 16Education Stanton School
page.content: Our cook came to this school. School was very different then. If children were naughty they'd get the cane. If they couldn't answer a question , they'd wear a dunce's cap. The infants wrote on slates using a scratchy stylus. Older children had steel nibbed pens which spluttered. Now we have books, pencils, biros, felt tips and roller pens. The infant classroom had an open fire. There was also a smokey stove. Now we have oil fired central heating. There were parafin lamps. We have modern neon strip lighting. The toilets were outside earth closets. Ours are inside flushing toilets and urinals. Some children walked 3 miles to school. They brought jam sandwiches and drank water from the village tap. We come by bus or taxi and have good school dinners cooked in the school kitchen.
